Title: OptiPNG: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in OptiPNG might result in user-assisted execution of
    arbitrary code.

Background.Text: OptiPNG is a PNG optimizer that recompresses image files to a smaller size, without losing any information.

Description.Text: Roy Tam reported a use-after-free vulnerability in the GIFReadNextExtension() function in lib/pngxtern/gif/gifread.c leading to a memory corruption when reading a GIF image.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted GIF image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All OptiPNG users should upgrade to the latest version:
